snippet: Cutting back on energy waste — and cutting carbon emissions in the process — can take just a few simple fixes, a new study says.
abstract: Report by Energy Efficiency for All details number of simple fixes for cutting down on energy waste that could help New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio in his ambitious goal of accomplishing 80 percent reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2050; goal faces unique obstacle in that much of energy waste in city comes from apartment building residents allowing heat to escape from overheated apartments; while many of changes proposed in report are simple, challenge remains in getting residents and building owners to implement them.
lead_paragraph: Cutting back on energy waste — and cutting carbon emissions in the process — can take just a few simple fixes, a new study says.

headline.main: Study Urges New York Buildings to Upgrade Heating Systems to Cut Emissions
headline.print_headline: Closing a Window to Open the Door to Home Efficiency
